result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Jean Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 09/20/15 and additional payments due the 20th of each month thereafter. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance  will be due Forthwith and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court. Court sets restitution at $0.
Huber for work, work search, and treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela Jean Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Angela Jean Miller in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke. Morgan Wills, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense, and defendant.
Court ordered defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, with 58 days credit for time served, with huber for work, work search, and treatment.
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges.    Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 09-20-2015 and additional payments due the 20th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
Court sets restitution at $0.
 
filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angela Jean Miller not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Case heard off the record.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Angela Jean Miller not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for a status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FAMILY DOLLAR.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Angela Jean Miller in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Angela Jean Miller in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Angela Jean Miller
Current: 9711 W CAPITOL DR, Milwaukee, WI 53222   (Effective: 04-30-2015)
Prior: 3752 East Mallory Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53110
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Angela Jean Miller not in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
